Functions/Subroutines

timestep Module Reference

timestepping and velocity routines are contained in this module More...

Functions/Subroutines

subroutine pmotion ()
 implement adams bashforth time-stepping scheme to move particles

adaptive timestep can be set in run.in in which case a comparison between 2nd and 3rd order scheme is used to estimate error and hence adjust the timestep

subroutine calc_velocity (u, i)
 get the velocity of each particle subject to the superfluid velocity plus any normal fluid/forcing, if a magnetic field tension force is also accounted for
subroutine mesh_velocity
 if the mesh size is set to be larger than 0 in run.in then we calculate both the normal and superfluid velocities at the mesh points to print to file
subroutine biot_savart (i, u)
 the desingularised biot savart integral

note the LIA part is calculated in calc_velocity

subroutine biot_savart_shift (i, u, shift)
 as above but shifts the particles (by a vector shift) for periodicity
subroutine biot_savart_general (x, u)
 calculate the velocity field at a point x induced by the vortices now using more general biot savart integral


subroutine biot_savart_general_shift (x, u, shift)
 as above but allows a shift for periodicity

Detailed Description

timestepping and velocity routines are contained in this module

real,dimension(3),intent(out)  u,

)
